column5: Manufacture of Na₂SiO₃ from sand & soda ash
Estimated energy to remove pore water (e.g. oven drying, approx.)
If organics used for porosity (assumed ~10% mass); CO₂ from fuel + polymer oxidation
Precursor NaAlO₂ from bauxite (assumed ~10 GJ/t alumina in Bayer process)
Energy for heating autoclave, stirring, etc. (moderate heat, ~100–200 °C)
Drying product (low-temp) and any activation; assumed no organic template (no high-temp calcination)
Sum of stages (raw material production is the largest contributor)
Embed. energy for chemicals (e.g. NaOH, HCl, ethanol); heavy use of reactants in process
Energy for solvent exchange and supercritical drying (high pressure + heating)
Approx. total per manufacturer: ~53.9 GJ/t and 4.3 tCO₂/t
High nitrate medium (~1.5 g NaNO₃/L); nutrients contribute minimal embedded energy/CO₂
Dilute nutrient medium (~75 mg NaNO₃/L); very low embedded energy/CO₂ per liter
High NaHCO₃ (~16.8 g/L) for carbon source; soda ash production is energy-intensive
